sense.def:
To fight something
pomeni, da si odločno prizadevamo nekaj preprečiti.

To fight for something
pomeni, da si odločno prizadevamo nekaj dobiti ali doseči.

seg.quote: They will fight for their rights.

sense.def:
To fight
pomeni poskušati telesno poškodovati drugega človeka.

seg.quote: I learned how to fight other boys.
He had fought in the First World War.
We were only metres away from the fighting.

sense.def:
A fight
je položaj, v katerem ljudje drug drugega poskušajo zadeti ali telesno poškodovati.

seg.quote: There would be fights sometimes between the workers.

sense.def:
To fight about something
pomeni prepirati se o nečem.

seg.quote: It's nice not having to fight you about housework.

sense.def:
Kadar politiki
fight an election
, poskušajo zmagati na volitvah.

To fight an emotion or desire
pomeni močno se truditi, da ne bi občutili ali pokazali čustva ali želje ali ravnali v skladu s tistim čustvom ali željo.

seg.quote: He fought the urge to cry.

sense.def:
To fight one's way somewhere
pomeni s težavo nekam priti, navadno zato, ker nas ovira veliko ljudi.

To put up a fight
pomeni zelo se bojevati proti človeku, močnejšemu od nas.

To fight back against someone
pomeni truditi se, da bi se zavarovali pred človekom, ki nas je napadel ali nam povzročil težave, in ga ustaviti ali premagati.

seg.quote: The importing countries could fight back with laws of their own.

sense.def:
To fight back an emotion
pomeni močno se truditi, da nekega čustva ne bi občutili, pokazali ali se ravnali ravnali v skladu z njim.

To fight off something
pomeni, da nam nekaj, na primer bolezen ali neprijeten občutek, uspe odgnati.

seg.quote: We can fight off most minor ailments.

sense.def:
To fight off someone
pomeni uspešno odgnati nekoga, ki nas je napadel, tako da se bojujemo z njim.

Kadar dve osebi ali skupini
fight something out
, se bojujeta ali prepirata, dokler ena od njiju ne zmaga.

seg.quote: ...while the European nations were fighting it out on the battlefield.
